alert.note: Alert for Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Seminole, east central Lake and northwestern Orange Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Plymouth, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sanford, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, Ocoee and Winter Garden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
